entry.title: Re: Best Practice for data transfer between EPLAN and SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu 

Thanks again for your remark.

As already mentioned,

  • The SAP ECTR Interface to EPLAN is not available for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition; it’s only supported in Private Cloud or On-Premises.
  • In Public Cloud, integration must be carried out via SAP Integration Suite (Standard Edition) using OData/SOAP APIs or file exchange. The Starter Edition is usually insufficient due to connector and volume limits.
  • While there’s no official reference case published, such integrations have been done using middleware or staging setups on SAP BTP.

There can be some inconsistencies or outdated references in SAP Notes and KBAs, particularly regarding Public Cloud compatibility, since many Notes were originally written for on-premise or private cloud contexts. It is worth verifying.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Maintenance Planner – Frequently Asked Questions
entry.content:
Hi

I see this is an older blog but will try asking anyway

I have been trying to Plan an upgrade to BW4 HANA 2023 using a system track.

Being unable to see how to make that happen I logged an issue.

I was then pointed to a note  2973264 - Maintenance Planner: plan a conversion to SAP BW/4HANA using a system track updated in March 2023.

"It is currently not supported to plan a conversion to SAP BW/4HANA using a system track."

Its now over 2 years since then ....  no progress ?

I was hoping the benefits of  the track feature  to ensure a consistent software bundle across a system landscape was well understood.

Would you have any insights as to when this may be available in Maintenance Planner?

I am not sure if this also applies to planning for S4 HANA?

Regards

Matt

Kind Regards

Rebeca

entry.title: Re: SAP ES版本中，单位换算和汇率换算是否有提供公共类
entry.content:
Hi,

For alternative unit of measure (UoM) info of a product, you can try using the BOI I_PRODUCTTP_2. In it, you'll find node of alternative uoms and the node of sales view where a sales uom (from the alternative uoms) might be assigned.

Best Regards,
Fancy

entry.title: Default Loading Group in Material Master to Prevent Shipping Point Error
entry.content:
We are encountering the following SAP SD error during sales order processing:

Ship.condition 01 loading grp plant MY18 StLoc FG91 not defined (V1358)

This happens when the Loading Group (LOSGR) is missing or not maintained in the material master, causing shipping point determination to fail.

Is there a way to default the Loading Group value (e.g., '0001') automatically in the material master when it is not maintained, either through configuration or enhancement (user exit/BADI)?

  • If yes, what is the recommended approach to ensure all new and existing materials have a valid Loading Group to prevent this error?

  • If this requires an ABAP enhancement, could you please advise on the recommended user exit or BADI to use for auto-populating the Loading Group during material creation or change?

entry.title: Re: Default Loading Group in Material Master to Prevent Shipping Point Error
entry.content: Ayoko ng BADI ENHANCEMENT. Config lang tinatangap ko na sagot. Okay?

entry.title: Re: Unable to add menu option in test RF app
entry.content:
Hello 

In Cloud WM there is no "05 menu" provided for "Outbound" . As you mentioned "post good issue", I assume the logic transaction you are looking for is "Consumption" which is submenu "04 Consumption" of outbound process. 

In Private Cloud it's "05 Consumption". But in Public Cloud it's "04 Consumption".

Best regards,

ZZ

entry.title: SAP EHS Waste Management in S/4HANA
entry.content:
1. Introduction

SAP Waste Management helps organizations manage both hazardous and non-hazardous waste. It offers an end-to-end process from waste generation to final disposal with regulatory compliance built in. This blog outlines the key steps and integration options.

2. Business Value

SAP Waste Management enables legal compliance, streamlines waste operations, and improves visibility. It helps reduce costs and risks associated with improper waste handling. With embedded analytics, organizations can monitor waste generation and improve sustainability.

3. Core Concepts

Key concepts include Waste Streams, Disposal Channels, Waste Permits, and Transportation Documents. Each of these plays a role in ensuring proper tracking and compliance from waste generation to disposal.

4. Roles & Responsibilities

  • Environmental Manager: Oversees compliance, permits, and waste processes
  • Production Operator: Initiates waste transfer requests
  • Master Data Specialist: Maintains substance and material data

Each role uses dedicated Fiori apps with specific responsibilities.

5. Step-by-Step Waste Management Process

 

Supporting Setup and Data Flow Steps (Embedded by Subsection)

  1. Manage Regulations: Pre-delivered waste codes are configured in the system under compliance requirements.
  2. Manage Material: Create internal materials and assign waste codes, which indirectly links them to relevant regulations.
  3. My Transporters and Disposers: Assign materials to locations and define environment-related details like country and region. Create Business Partners with roles such as Transporter or Disposer.
  4. My Waste Stream: Link materials to storage locations and define the Environmental Management structure including waste generator and point of generation.
  5. Disposal Channel Configuration: Using SPRO, configure waste document types, maintain permit types, and create permits. Activate the disposal channel.
  6. Transfer Request Posting: Post material quantity data via the Waste Transfer Request app. Use T-code MMPV if the posting period is closed.
  7. Transportation Document Processing: Create and release documents to complete the waste disposal process.

SAP Process Flow –

 

 

5.1 Waste Characterization

  • Fiori App: Manage Material Data - Environment Management (F4864)
  • Add material with emissions relevance and classify it as waste
  • Assign hazardous or non-hazardous waste type
  • Link to existing logistic materials for traceability
  • Maintain physical/chemical properties and analytical composition
  • Assign relevant waste codes based on compliance lists
  • Add related packaged products and dangerous goods data
    This step is the foundation of waste management. Here, you define materials as waste and determine whether they are hazardous or non-hazardous. You assign relevant waste codes and integrate dangerous goods classifications, if applicable. It also involves setting physical and chemical properties of the waste material and linking related packaged products for proper labeling and handling during transport.

5.2 Waste Stream Identification

  • Fiori App: My Waste Streams - Waste Management (F5410)
  • Define point of waste generation and assign waste material
  • Connect waste stream to storage and disposal locations
  • Link waste stream with disposal channels
  • Maintain scheduling and classification of waste type
  • Ensure linkage with proper permits and transfer logic
    In this step, you create a waste stream that connects a specific type of waste to its generation point and planned disposal route. It defines the lifecycle of the waste within your organization, helping track movements and assign responsibilities. You can associate waste streams with disposal channels and storage locations, enabling complete traceability and documentation.

5.3 Permits & Compliance Requirements

  • Fiori App: My Permits (F5192), Manage Compliance Requirements
  • Create permit with validity period and issuing authority
  • Assign permit to location and waste material
  • Define allowed quantities, types, and transport limitations
  • Setup compliance requirement paragraphs and regulatory limits
  • Link compliance requirements to waste scenarios for automatic checks
    Permits are required by law to regulate how much and what kind of waste a company can generate, store, and dispose of. In this step, you create waste permits tied to specific locations and waste streams. You define regulatory constraints, valid waste types, and allowed limits. Compliance Requirements are also set up and linked with scenarios to enforce those rules through automated validations.

5.4 Waste Transfer Request

  • Fiori App: My Waste Transfer Requests - Waste Management (F6083)
  • Initiate request when waste is ready for pickup
  • Specify material, quantity, storage location, and disposal channel
  • Include information on related permits and packaging
  • Submit for review and approval by Environmental Manager
  • Triggers next step for document generation
    This transactional step is initiated by a production operator when waste needs to be moved. It includes details such as type of waste, quantity, source location, and assigned disposal channel. The Waste Transfer Request ensures controlled movement of waste and is typically linked to permits and compliance checks before a transport document can be generated.

5.5 Waste Transportation Document

  • Fiori App: Manage Waste Transfer Requests - Waste Management (F6084), My Waste Transportation Documents (F5290)
  • Generate transport document from approved transfer request
  • Document includes waste details, transport route, and handlers
  • Supports both hazardous and non-hazardous waste formats
  • Enables output in print or electronic format via Output Management
  • Forms may be country-specific (e.g., US Manifest, German e-Begleitschein)
    The Environmental Manager uses this step to create legally compliant transportation documents based on approved transfer requests. These documents serve as manifests and include waste types, packaging details, transporter/disposer information, and permit numbers. The system supports form output management for both print and digital submission.

5.6 Analytics & Monitoring

  • Fiori App: Waste Analytics - Waste Management (F6956)
  • Monitor waste data across plants, materials, and time frames
  • Analyze trends in waste generation, transport, and disposal
  • Track compliance KPIs and waste type performance
  • Use filters to drill down into transporters, disposers, and permit usage
  • Export analytics for sustainability and regulatory reporting
    The final step in the process enables users to monitor and analyze waste generation, storage, and disposal across various dimensions like time, location, and waste type. The analytics dashboard supports real-time data visualization and is useful for sustainability reporting and internal audits. It also allows early detection of compliance risks and bottlenecks in the waste process chain.

6. Output Management in Waste Management

SAP supports output via print and form templates. Output Parameter Determination (BRF+) enables automatic form selection. Templates such as FDP_WID_HWM_EN and FDP_WTD_BGS_DE are available.

7. Integration with SAP Product Compliance

Waste Management integrates with Product Compliance for accurate material data, regulatory content, and dangerous goods information. This ensures proper labeling and compliance.

8. Summary & Best Practices

Summary Table: Fiori Apps and Associated Roles

Process Step

Fiori App Name & ID

User Role Template

Waste Characterization

Manage Material Data - Environment Management (F4864)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Waste Stream Identification

My Waste Streams - Waste Management (F5410)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Permits & Compliance Requirements

My Permits (F5192), Manage Compliance Requirements

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Waste Transfer Request

My Waste Transfer Requests - Waste Management (F6083)

SAP_BR_PRODN_OPTR_EHS_INFO

Waste Transportation Document

Manage Waste Transfer Requests (F6084), My Waste Transportation Docs (F5290)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Analytics & Monitoring

Waste Analytics - Waste Management (F6956)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Use SAP Waste Management to track waste, stay compliant, and enable sustainability. Align your master data, permit definitions, and waste streams for a smooth process.

9. References

  • SAP Help Portal: Waste Management

entry.title: Getting Started with Joule Studio in SAP Build - Part 2: Developing and Deploying a Joule Skill
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In Last Part of this series, we covered how to provision Joule Studio in your SAP BTP Landscape. Now that your system and entitlements are in place, it's time to dive into the hands-on development of your first Joule Skill and learn how to deploy and test it.

This guide walks through creating a custom skill, integrating backend actions, configuring responses, and deploying it for use in your SAP environment.

 

Develop and Deploy Joule Skills

Step-by-Step Development

  • Launch the SAP Build Lobby and log in using your IAS credentials.

 

  • Click Create, then select the Joule Skill tile.

 

 

  • Enter a name, description, and define the functionality of your skill.

 

  • After project creation:
    • Click Create again and select Joule Skill.

 

    • Add actions, processes, conditions, or automations.

 

    • For example, add an action to retrieve Business Partner data from S/4HANA PCE.

 

 

  • Configure:
    • An environment variable for the destination.

 

    • Any mandatory input parameters.
    • Skill inputs from user input if needed.
  • Add a Send Message component:

 

    • Use the Message Editor.

 

    • Multiple message type is available, I am choosing List type and map the results from the action response.

 

 

 

 

  • Save, release, and deploy the skill to your environment.

 

 

  • Go to the environment to test the skill.

 

 

  • Launch the standalone Joule interface, interact with the skill, and review logs as needed.

 

 

 

 

Conclusion

In this part, you’ve taken the next big step in your Joule Studio journey—developing and deploying your first custom Joule Skill using SAP Build. From designing the skill logic and integrating backend actions, to configuring dynamic responses and testing in a real environment, you've now seen how intuitive and flexible Joule Studio can be.

This hands-on experience demonstrates how easily you can create intelligent, AI-powered automations that directly serve your unique business needs—all without writing complex code..

entry.title: Re: Modify VWPOS in a Enhancement to determine a new item category during sales order creation VA01
entry.content: Hello Mr. Lakshmipathi, Thank you for the excellent point. You are absolutely right; providing the business context is crucial. Let me clarify the requirement. Business Requirement: The business needs to run a specific type of "combo" promotion. The rule is: If a customer purchases a specific, designated "main/parent" item, they become eligible to receive a different, specific "bonus/child" item for free within the same sales order. These are not Sales BOM’s though, the combination of materials are to be maintained in a Z-Table. Example Scenario: • If a customer buys "Product A" (the main/parent item), they are entitled to receive "Product B”, “Product C” (the bonus item) at a 100% discount. • If "Product A" is not in the sales order, then "Product B" must be treated as a standard, fully priced item. The Key Challenges that Require a Custom Solution: 1. Dynamic & Real-Time: The eligibility of the "bonus" item must be determined in real-time, based on the entire contents of the sales order. a. If a user adds the "bonus" item first and the "main" item later, the bonus item must automatically switch from being a paid item to a free item. b. Conversely, if the user adds both and then deletes the "main" item, the bonus item must instantly revert to being a fully priced item. 2. Many-to-Many Relationships: The relationships are not always simple one-to-one. a. One "main" item might make several different "bonus" items eligible. b. A single "bonus" item might be made eligible by several different "main" items. c. These relationships need to be maintained easily by business users in a custom table, as they change frequently with marketing campaigns. Why We Need to Change the Item Usage Value: After evaluating several technical options, we've determined that the cleanest and most robust solution is to drive this logic through standard Item Category Determination. The goal is not just to apply a 100% discount. We want the system to treat the eligible "bonus" item as a true free-of-charge item from the start. This means it should have the correct item category (custom ZTNN). By programmatically setting the Item Usage (VWPOS) to a custom value (e.g., 'ZPCE' for Promotion) in a user exit/BADI, we are trying to provide a "signal" to the standard configuration. The standard Item Category Determination rule (in VOV4) will see this signal and automatically assign the correct ZTNN item category. I hope this clarifies the business driver and the reasoning behind the technical approach. Any further insights would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Re: Default Loading Group in Material Master to Prevent S...
entry.content: The recommended approach would be to make the Loading Group field as mandatory in material master.  This can be done via OMSR to find out the field selection group for Loading Group, OMS2 to get the field reference and finally set the field as mandatory in OMS9

entry.title: Beyond SAP Cloud - Episode 34: DevOps for Fiori on-premise with BTP CI/CD service
entry.content:
In this video, the focus is on CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) services for on-premise Fiori deployments, rather than for BTP. We highlight how CI/CD can streamline development processes by ensuring that code in a Git repository remains in sync with SAP systems. The use of webhooks triggers automatic deployments, with a technical user handling the deployment process, ensuring consistency between the Git repository and SAP systems. This approach helps prevent coding conflicts, ensuring that developers work with the latest version of the code base.

Takeaways

  • CI/CD can be useful even for on-premise deployments, not just BTP deployments.
  • Many companies still deploy to on-premise systems like SAP Fiori, ECC, or gateway systems.
  • Without CI/CD, developers may deploy directly to the system without committing code to GitHub, leading to conflicts.
  • It's essential to keep the Git repository and the SAP system in sync to avoid version conflicts.
  • If code is only in the system and not in the Git repository, it can lead to difficulties in managing and tracking changes.
  • The code base in the system should not be used for development purposes directly; it should be in Git.
  • CI/CD can help synchronize code between Git repositories and SAP systems automatically.
  • By using a webhook, CI/CD can trigger deployments to SAP systems when updates are made to the Git repository.
  • The deployment process should be automated through CI/CD pipelines to ensure consistency and avoid human error.
  • It’s recommended to have a dedicated technical user for deployment to enforce consistency in the CI/CD process.

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: AI-Powered Fraud Prevention
entry.content:
As we are all (too much) aware, Artificial Intelligence has changed our working habits. Sometimes for the good, such as creating a nice illustration for this blog, but also sometimes to the benefit of the dark force when used with malicious intents.

In the area of fraud, AI-generated deception strategies have become more and more sophisticated.

While confirming during a Teams meeting with the Treasurer that a request for an urgent transfer was legitimate and was previously a sure protection against business email compromise scams, advanced audio and video deepfakes have rendered this earlier failsafe obsolete.

So, should we just give up and all move to just one office location so that you can get in person confirmations on sensitive transactions?

No, of course not.

In this blog, I’d like to discuss how SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance can be enhanced with “last mile checks” from Trustpair to catch any fraudulent activity before it’s too late.

 

Building a resilient treasury governance

 

With ninety percent of US companies reporting being targeted by cyber fraud in 2024, and thirty-eight percent targeted by payment fraud more than 10 times over the same period as per Trustpair’s Fraud in the Cyber Era: 2025 Fraud Trends & Insights, this is clearly not an isolated issue and it’s not going away any time soon. And just to put it into perspective, the FBI’s latest Internet Crime Report mentions that business email compromise alone totalled $2,770,151,146 reported losses in 2024...

To combat this scourge, companies are investing in 3 main areas:

 

Training & Awareness

Authorizations

Technology

Training & Awareness and Authorizations are perfect examples of preventative control measures: by reducing the fraud attack surface, companies reduce the likelihood of a fraud succeeding.

But much like phishing attacks, if the sample is large enough and the incentives sufficiently compelling, chances are that business email compromise scams will still succeed. And when you think that findings from the 2025 AFP® Payments Fraud and Control Survey indicate that only 22% of organizations were able to recover 75% or more of the funds lost due to payments fraud in 2024, more proactive measures are needed.

This is where technology plays an important role, in my opinion, to address the remaining gap and moves the needle to earlier detection – before the loss is incurred.

 

Fraud prevention triangle

 

Indeed, what if the treasury employee targeted already has the role and authorization to perform the transaction, had the relevant training and is aware that these types of attacks exist but has been convinced by an advanced deepfake that the request is legitimate and still processes the payment?

This where technology takes the relay and enhances human checks to provide a last dependable defense layer based on 3 angles creating the Fraud Prevention Triangle. This depiction below is not from me so all credit here goes to my colleague Emanuele Fumeo - Finance Solution Advisor at SAP:

 

 

 

Anomaly detection

By screening large volumes of transactional data, SAP Business Integrity Screening helps identify anomalous activity quickly using flexible rule sets and predictive analyses to uncover potential fraud patterns or deviations from policy.

Should the attack follow a known pattern, it would be detected at this stage.

 

Business Partner Screening

Within SAP Business Integrity Screening, a dedicated module enables enterprises across all industries to screen their business partners against lists of denied persons and organizations published by governments and global institutions, thus ensuring their compliance with guidelines, regulations, and legislation.

If the business party involved in the transaction has already been flagged by authorities as being on a sanctioned list for instance, then this second automated step would prevent any further processing.

 

Account Validation

Finally, even if the attack hasn’t been detected and the party seems legitimate, Account Validation – also known as Confirmation of Payee, is the last mile check. It is the ultimate control and here, TrustPair can automatically perform one-time checks for new vendors in SAP Ariba but also continuous monitoring of vendor master data and payment files in the ERP system to detect risks, abnormal amounts and duplicates. Ultimately making the entire process more secure and efficient with a last protection net validating the company identity, but also the bank account ownership against banking sources.

Together, human factor prevention with adequate training, attack surface reduction with relevant authorizations and advanced technology detection can help ensure that even advanced fraudulent attacks are deterred – hence safeguarding the company’s financials.

And this must be done consistently across the end-to-end procure to pay process but also directly embedded within the transactional systems to ensure adequate and timely action.

What about you, how does your company address the AI-powered fraud threat? I look forward to reading your thoughts and comments on this blog.

And if you are interested in learning more about TrustPair’s solutions for SAP and how it applies a 5-layer validation with external sources, smart algorithms and complementary checks to secure the source to pay chain, then have a look Trustpair Payment Fraud Prevention on the SAP Store.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere: オブジェクトストア 入門編
entry.content:
はじめに

SAP Business Data CloudではSAPのビジネスアプリケーション間のデータを共通のデータモデルとしてデータセットおよびセマンティック（項目名の用語や意味合い）を整え、SAP データプロダクトとして提供します。また、お客様独自の要件やデータソースに対してはカスタムデータプロダクトを作成することができます。

これによりSAPアプリケーションのデータだけでなく、SAP以外のデータも整備しAIエージェントに必要なデータとして提供できるため、ダッシュボードでデータを可視化するだけではなく、Jouleを使いながら対話形式でさらなるデータ分析の深堀やインサイトを得るなどデータ活用の幅を広げることができます。

そのような独自要件に則ったカスタムデータプロダクトの作成はSAP Datasphereの機能を用いて行いますが、本ブログではカスタムデータプロダクトの作成を行う領域にあたるSAP Datasphereのオブジェクトストアに関してご紹介いたします。

概要

オブジェクトストアは安価な受信ステージングエリアで大量のデータをロードおよび準備することを目的としており、以下の前提があります。

  • ビュー、データフロー、データアクセス制御、分析モデル、インテリジェントルックアップ、E/R モデルを作成したり、ビジネスビルダを使用したりすることはできません。

  • CSV ファイル、エンティティ、リモートテーブル、または通貨換算テーブルはインポートできません。SAP HANA スマートデータアクセスおよび SAP HANA スマートデータインテグレーションは、ストレージタイプが SAP HANA データベース (ディスクおよびインメモリ) のスペースでのみ使用されるため、適用されません 。

また、データは複製フロー、BWデータプロダクトジェネレーターを介してロードすることができます。

その他オブジェクトストアに関する詳細情報は以下もご確認下さい。

オブジェクトストアでのデータの取得および準備 
3538038 - SAP Datasphere オブジェクトストアの重要な考慮事項

本ブログでは接続を介したS/4HANAなどの外部システムから複製フローによりデータをオブジェクトストアへロードする方法をご紹介いたします。

  1. オブジェクトストアスペースの作成
  2. 複製フローの作成
  3. マージタスクの実行
  4. スペースへの共有

オブジェクトストアの作成

管理者ロールを持つユーザーは安価なステージングエリアで大量のデータをロードおよび準備することを目的としたオブジェクトストアにスペースを作成することができます。

オブジェクトスペースの作成は「スペース管理」＞「作成」より可能です。

スペース名やストレージタイプを選択します。

オブジェクトストアスペースの作成には「SAP HANAデータレイクファイル」を選択し「作成」します。

複製フローの作成

複製フローの作成・実行により空のターゲットテーブルが作成されます。この時点ではデータはターゲットテーブルへはロードされません。

（複製フローに関してはこちらのブログシリーズも併せてご確認ください：複製フローPart１: 複製フロー概要）

*注：オブジェクトストアの使用にはいくつかの考慮事項があります。例えば、複製フローの作成にはデルタ抽出可能なソースのみに対応している等いくつかの考慮事項があるため、次のSAP Note より詳細をご確認下さい。3538038 - SAP Datasphere オブジェクトストアの重要な考慮事項

マージタスクの実行

複製フローは、ターゲットテーブル の受信バッファにデータファイルを書き込みます。この受信バッファからローカルテーブル へのデータ更新を処理してデータを表示するには、①データ統合モニタよりマージタスクの実行あるいは➁タスクチェーンの作成によるマージタスクの実行が必要です。

①データ統合モニタよりマージタスクの実行

「データ統合モニタ」を表示すると以下のようにローカルテーブルにレコードが挿入されていないことが分かります。

画面右の「>」よりローカルテーブルの詳細を開きます。

「テーブルをマージ」よりマージタスクの実行が可能です。

また、以下のように日時や週次でのスケジュールを設定することも可能です。

➁タスクチェーンの作成によるマージタスクの実行

アクティビティに「マージ」を選択しタスクチェーンの作成・実行をします。

「①データ統合モニタよりマージタスクの実行」あるいは「➁タスクチェーンの作成によるマージタスクの実行」により受信バッファからローカルテーブルにデータが書き込まれ、レコードが挿入されます。

スペースへの共有

オブジェクトスペース内では変換フローを用いてテーブルの結合など変換を適用することができ、その後テーブルをスペースと共有することでフローやビュー、また分析モデルのソースとして利用することができます。

オブジェクトストアより共有されたテーブルをソースとしてモデリングや分析モデルの作成、SAP Analytics Cloudでのデータ参照も可能ですが、データフローや変換フローを用いてスペース内でデータを保持することでよりパフォーマンスを高く利用が可能です。

さいごに

最後までご覧いただきありがとうございました！

以下に関連する情報を記載していますので、併せてご確認ください。

  • オブジェクトストアでのデータの取得および準備 
  • 3538038 - SAP Datasphere オブジェクトストアの重要な考慮事項

複製フロー解説ブログシリーズ：

  • 複製フローPart１: 複製フロー概要
  • 複製フローPart2 : デルタキャプチャと変換フロー

entry.title: Re: The system did not generate the right dunning level a...
entry.content:
Dear Zhijun,

The dunning level 1 starts at days in arrear 7. Grace days are <= 7.

Days in arrears 7 <= grace days 7: Items in arrears <= 7 are not in dunning.

In you configuration the grace days is <= 7. The customer overdue line items are dunned after the grace period.

Kind regards,

Bhawesh

entry.title: Re: Modify VWPOS in a Enhancement to determine a new item...
entry.content:
It is really very difficult to understand the requirement from your latest post, because it is not in readable format. Probably, you would have copy pasted from some other source and before submitting the post, you would not have noticed the format.  Had to go through multiple times to understand your requirement.

Now coming to your requirement, yes you can play with VWPOS but please note VWPOS is not directly editable in va01 screens. So, the logic to be implemented would be in the backend. Without proper combination in vov4, changing VWPOS would impact item category determination in sales order. So, ensure, the right combination is maintained. Most importantly, if multiple items are involved, make sure your logic handles additions and deletions dynamically.

But I prefer to go with second option mentioned below taking into consideration, the pros and cons

If your goal is robustness, maintainability, and alignment with SAP best practices, then using the user exit or BADI is the better option. It allows you to:

  1. Evaluate the full sales order context
  2. Safely inject logic without modifying core SAP code
  3. Easily adapt to future changes in business rules or promotions

Direct backend changes to VWPOS might work for quick fixes, but they’re more brittle and harder to trace later.

entry.title: RAP Solution to update Absences (Infotype 2001)
entry.content:
In the context of Clean Core, we have started using RAP for all our API solutions. We have a requirement to update Absences (2001), Presence (2002) and Substitutions (2003). 

Currently known function modules to update Infotypes are "HR_MAINTAIN_MASTERDATA" and "HR_INFOTYPE_OPERATION". 

Unfortunately these function modules are not allowed in RAP since they make use of the statement CALL DIALOG.

Looked into the successor of "HR_MAINTAIN_MASTERDATA", CL_HRPA_MASTERDATA_BL. I do not find enough examples about how to use it for Infotypes 2001/2/3. 

Has anyone tried to work with Absences using RAP?

entry.title: Badi FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_VALIDATION does not have necessary fields for Validation for manual payments
entry.content:
We are working on implementing a custom validation to ensure that during manual payments, house bank selected matches the house bank used in the reference vendor invoice selected for payment. But however House bank and Account ID of Invoice selected (Post Outgoing Payment APP) is not updating in the Vendor Line item. Please suggest any other BAdi available  or any workaround to help us validate the house bank details present in Invoice at the time of payment. 

We implemented an enhancement using BAdi FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_VALDATION.

BAdi code:

if  accountingdocheader-transactioncode = 'FBDC_C014' ."and accountingdocheader-accountingdocumenttype = 'KZ'.

CONSTANTS lc_message_class TYPE symsgid VALUE 'FIN_SUB_VAL'.

CLEAR validationmessage.

validationmessage-msgid = lc_message_class.

validationmessage-msgty = 'E'.

validationmessage-msgno = '010'.

validationmessage-msgv1 = '61003000'.

RETURN.

endif.

entry.title: Re: Session 3 Recap & Highlights– Unpacking SAP Business Data Cloud for Enterprise Architects
entry.content:
Hi @alexanderroan 
 
In the SAP world, BDC Data Products and CDS Views in S/4HANA are both important tools for working with data — but they serve different purposes and are used in different ways.

🌐BDC Data Products (Business Data Cloud)
BDC Data Products are ready-to-use, high-quality data sets designed for sharing and consumption across applications, teams, or even customers.

- What is it?
A BDC data product is like a finished product that includes cleaned, enriched data. It's packaged in a way that business users can understand and use easily.

- What's inside?
Each data product includes not only the data itself but also business logic, models, and visualization tools — all combined into a "data package."

- How is it used?
These data products are used to power analytics, AI insights, and benchmarking.

📊S/4HANA CDS Views (Core Data Services)
CDS Views are more like the data "blueprints" used inside SAP systems like S/4HANA.

- What is it?
CDS views are technical models that pull data directly from database tables and reshape it into a business-friendly format.

- Why are they useful?
CDS views help developers and analysts get the right data in a consistent way without needing to write complex queries. They're also used to power reports, Fiori apps, or expose data as APIs.

- Where are they used?
CDS views mainly live inside SAP systems like S/4HANA and are used to access and integrate business data within SAP tools.

In short:
  • BDC Data Products are like finished meals ready to serve to business users.
  • CDS Views are like the ingredients and recipe used behind the scenes to prepare those meals.

Both are key parts of SAP’s data ecosystem — working together to help turn raw data into meaningful insights. Explore the available Data Products on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub - Data Products | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytics Cloud Optimized Story Experience API Re...
entry.content:
Hello @DomiK,

Your code has too much double quotes. Additionally with a isSendMail: false you'll never receive an e-mail. The following code works fine for me and I receive an e-mail:

var user = Application.getUserInfo().id;
Application.sendNotification(
	{
		title: "Test",
		content: "This is a journey into test",
		isSendEmail: true,
		mode: ApplicationMode.Present,
		receivers: [user]
	}
);

Best regards

Lothar

entry.title: Re: Use of Business Area in Enterprise Architecture
entry.content:
Hello,

Your approach is correct. Business area is no longer a recommended field, and hasn't been for a long time. I've even had SAP consulting confirm this on a previous cleint project to re-assure the client.

The best design in both ECC and S/4HANA is to use profit center to recognise 'area of responsibility' which often relates to a certain level of product or brand and potentially geography too. 

And yes, traditional GUI reports are not exactly great in terms of profit center group support.

I think the way most organisations get around this in ECC is:

- I believe you can save variants in standard trial balance with a list of profit centers (I can't remember, please check).
- Use report painter/writer
- Z-reports as variations of standard one (not that hard to develop)
- Download various runs of standard reports and combine in excel (not ideal I know)
- Use BW

If you are in S/4HANA you have extra options with Fiori and embedded analytics
- Try 'trial balance' app
- Or try the query browser in embedded analytics (something like I_ProfitCenterHierarchyNode)

Lot's of options to investigate. 
But just to confirm, if you have people responsible for profit for areas of geography the profit center is the right approach.

I highly recommend sticking to standard use of organisation elements for future proofing. Do not use segment for area of responsibility. Only use it for IFRS segment. Anyway without custom developments it's only derived from profit center.

Let me know what you decide after investigating the various options.

entry.title: Manage Usage Decision/field Scrap - Reverse MvT isn't possible
entry.content:
Hi all, 

We want to display a pop-up window with information when the Scrap field is filled in app Manage Usage Decisions.

 

When Quality Engineer fill this field by mistake, and Save it, it's not possible Reverse this movement. 

 

In old version "Record Usage Decision" app , in "Inspection Lot Stock" tab, if you enter quantity for "to scrap" quantity to be posted and click "enter" or "save button", there will have a pop-up window for this action as the attachment, in this pop-up "Reason for Mvmt" field is mandatory. it might help to remind engineer when they fulfill scrap field. 

 

You can Vote for our Influence  https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/346505/?section=sectionDetails

entry.title: Re: Unable to determine function module by OPEN_FI from ETC 00003010
entry.content:
This error typically means that SAP couldn’t find a function module linked to a Business Transaction Event (BTE) during output processing in VF03. It’s often triggered when the output type is configured for EDI or similar formats, but the system lacks the necessary function module assignment for the BTE involved.

Where you can check this issue is go to FIBF, Check the event 00003010 under “Environment > Info System > BTEs”, Ensure a function module is assigned to this event. If not, this should be the root cause
Make sure, the Partner Profile for EDI is properly configured in we20.
Needless to mention, if other billing types are working fine and no issue, then, it could be data issue and not configuration

entry.title: Benefits (Insurance Plan) Configuration - SuccessFactors Employee Central Global Benefits
entry.content:
Benefits (Insurance Plan) – Configuration 

To create Benefit Insurance, the following steps to be implemented

Step1: Create Insurance Provider – Insurance provider is basically a service provider who provides insurance services to corporates

Step2: Create Enrollee options – Multiple enrollee options can be created for an employee

Step3: Pay Components (if payroll automation is enabled) – To be tagged at Insurance Level so that the deductions/contributions are maintained in the deduction statement

Step4: Rate Chart Rule for Contribution/Deductions – Based on the enrollee options and other conditions contributions can be assigned

Step5: Insurance Rate Chart – Define all the eligible enrollee options and respective structural attributes for automation of user interface

Step6: Insurance Plan – Create an Insurance Plan and Tag the attributes created above

Step7: Legal Entity for Benefit – Create a record to enable the benefit is applicable to respective legal entity users/Employees

Step8: Benefit Schedule Period – Consists of Schedule

            Benefit Schedule – consists of all dated related to Benefits enrollments and claims

Step9: Benefit – Tag the relevant attributes that were created and complete the process

  

Insurance Provider

 

Eligible Enrollee Options

 

 

Coverage

 

Pay Components

 

 

Rate rule to maintain contributions based on options selected during enrollment process

 

Rate chart to tag all the relative attributes

Insurance plan to be created with all the attributes created

Legal Entity for Benefit:

Benefit Schedule Period and Benefit Schedule

Benefit to be created as below with all the attributes which tagged as below

 

Additional platform settings/steps

The lookup screens below be created before the configuration start to see the screens to implantation (Back End) and employee enrollments and claim (Front End)

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Global Benefits 

 

Conclusion: Benefit Insurance plans is SuccessFactors is a matured product with automation features and payroll integration options. enrollments process of this benefit will be updated in my next blog as a follow-up content.

entry.title: Re: SAP HANA PARAMETERS TUNING FOR PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"

  • Each Tenant DB can have different parameter values set, depending on each customer requirement
  • It is recommended that each Tenant has these best practice parameter values in place before productive use starts i.e. run these checks immediately after installation or upgrade, implement parameter value recommendations and test that these meet your business requirements
  • The output of the script will only show Hana parameters which are not currently set as per best practice recommendations
  • It will give recommended parameter value settings and note references on the particular parameter/topic area
  • In the P (Priority) column, you can see the most critical parameters to be set - 1 has highest priority
  • It will give actual SQL commands (ALTER statements) to set the parameter to the required value
  • And also an UNDO_COMMAND should you need to revert the parameter
  • If opening a support case with SAP Technical Support, providing the output of this parameter check will help to speed up the analysis"

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us great  a lot.

 

🙂

 

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: Re: (PT) ATCUD and Digital signature in SOAP API
entry.content:
You are likely working with an older version of the API or your system hasn not been updated to include the Portugal-specific extensions. Ensure, you are working with the latest API version as per this SAP documentation  and it includes Portugal-specific segments
Check in SFW5 whether Portugal localization is active in your system because, in S/4HANA, country specific fields like PT_DigitalSignature are activated via BC sets or country specific customizing

entry.title: How to know SAP license usage of my company?
entry.content:
Hi Experts 

In our company, we have procured 155 SAP licenses.  We have installed SAP ECC and S/4HANA (155 licenses ). 

Now I want to get a report about the remaining license count and usage of the existing licenses. 

Please advise.

BR 

Indka

entry.title: BILL OF MATERIALS (BOM)
entry.content:
BOM: - 

BOM -> Bill Of materials is a function which is widely used across many modules in sap. Modules namely Production planning (PP) will use mainly material Bom to get the finished product , Sales and distribution (SD) will also use material Bom but they will use the material Bom is and only if they are selling a component which is having multiple sub components for example computer and when it comes to Plant Maintenance (PM) there are 3 types of BOM namely Functional location Bom , Equipment Bom , Material Bom.

there is field BOM usage while creating BOM based on the requirement the usage key will changes for plant maintenance we will use key number 4 when it comes to production we will use 1 .  

                                                                 

                                                                                  

In each and every Bom one of the item screen will be present and  we can observe that there is item category , material number and quantity. we will maintain each of the fields.
In plant maintenance the below are the things that mostly will be maintained or mostly that are being used 

item category : -

 N -> Non stock item -> if we set the item category as non stock item (N) then a purchase requestion number will be raised from Bom and after the pr will be converted to PO and then Goods receipt in MIGO. Basically this will be done by persons who are responsible for Material Management(MM).

l -> Stock item -> if we set the item category as stock item then it means the stock is present in the inventory and it can be used.

R -> variable size item ->  if we set the item category as variable size item it means the materials size may vary depends upon the situation. Mostly this type of item category will be used by the automobile industries.                                                                                      

Quantity -> enter the number of quantity that is required.
Material number -> the materials which are required will be entered in this field.

Functional location Bom: - 

The functional location Bom refers to structured list of materials that are assigned to functional location. The components or materials which are added in the functional location Bom are required to maintain or to perform tasks for all the equipment's that are installed in the functional location.

Whenever a maintenance order or a work order is being created for the functional location for which Bom is created then these are the materials that are necessary for carrying out the maintenance activities.

To create a functional location Bom we can follow the path 

Sap easy access screen -> logistics -> plant maintenance -> maintenance of technical objects -> bill of material -> functional location Bom -> create
                                                                                        or 
                                                             We can also use the t-code : - IB11

here after entering into the functional location creation screen we will provide the functional location, Bom usage as '4' -> for plant maintenance.

then we will be navigated to the item screen in which the components are to be added.

Equipment Bom: - 

Equipment Bom refers to the materials that are required for maintaining of equipment. It defines all the spare parts, subassemblies, or tools that are required for maintaining or repairing that individual piece of equipment.

To create equipment Bom we will follow the path:
Sap easy access screen -> logistics -> plant maintenance -> maintenance of technical objects -> bill of material -> equipment Bom    -> create 
                                                                                                                     (or) 
                                                                                                            t-code : - IB01

Same here we will just provide the equipment plant and Bom usage in the next screen

we will provide the quantity material and item category too.

When a material in the BOM contains subcomponents, it indicates that additional materials are necessary then only we can use the main material. So then we will create as material Bom. Equipment Bom can also be created just to ensure that if any component that needs to damaged or it has to be replaced then they can also refer for BOM.

MATERIAL BOM: -

Material Bom is also a structured list but this Bom is mostly used by the production planning module because to get the raw materials as finished or semifinished product and it plays a vital role in other modules like SD ,MM, PM.

To create a material Bom we will follow the path :-
Sap easy access screen -> logistics -> plant maintenance -> maintenance of technical objects -> bill of material -> material bom -> create 
                                                                                                                 (or) 
                                                                                                      t-code : - CS01 

Here we will provide the material number , plant , Bom usage 

Then in the next screen we will maintain the items or materials whether they are stock item or non-stock item and its quantity.

After creating of material Bom for a material we can observe in equipment or functional location bom there is assembly checkbox beside PO quantity.

In each of the creation screen you can observe that there is change number it will be will be given when Engineering Change Management (ECM) is being implemented and it will collect all the information about all the details like who has changed the Bom, when they have changed etc... 

In conclusion we can say BOM - Bill of materials will play a vital role in SAP and can be used in various conditions.

Summary: - 

BOM will be used by across various modules - PP will use the material bom for the producing the finished goods, PM will use Equipment bom , Functional Bom , Material Bom too , MM will use the material bom to send the material to vendor in subcontracting process, SD will use it to sale the components to the customer etc.... 

BOMs help in planning, maintenance, procurement, and efficient execution of operations.

If any issues feel free to comment.

Regards ,
Neeraj.

entry.title: String was not recognized as valid DateTime error
entry.content:
Hi all,

We would like to post notifications (IW23) via a PowerAutomate.
Unfortunately, this only works if the browser language is English.

For example, in German we get the following error message:
"error": {
"code": 500,
"message": "BadGateway",
"innerError": {
"status": 500,
"error": {
"message": "String was not recognized as a valid DateTime."

Connection: SAP OData
API: /sap/opu/odata/sap/api_maintnotification/
OData Entity Name: MaintenanceNotification
Method: POST
RequiredEndDate: 2025-12-25T00:00:00Z

We have tried the following date Formats:
2025-12-25 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
20251225 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
25.12.2025 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
25-12-2025 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
2025.12.25 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
2025-12-25T00:00:00Z --> BadGateway

The error CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME should come from /IWCOR/CL_DS_EDM_DATE_TIME====CM004. The date is expected here as follows --> ISO-8601 format:
FIND REGEX `^([[[:digit:]]{1,4})-([[:digit:]]{1,2})-([[:digit:]]{1,2})T(([[:digit:]]{1,2}):([[:digit:]]{1,2})(? ::([[:digit:]]{1,2})(\.[[:digit:]]{1,7})?)?$` "#EC NOTEXT
IN iv_timestamp
SUBMATCHES lv_year lv_month lv_day lv_hour lv_minute lv_second lv_fracs.

What is the problem here?
In which format must the date be transmitted?

Best regards,
Marco

entry.title: Re: Best Practice to Block a Plant in SAP
entry.content:
Deleting a plant from configuration is not recommended in a live system. It can Break historical reporting, Cause inconsistencies in transactional data & Impact audit trails

Some of the Best Practices to block a Plant are

  1. Ensure there are no open purchase orders, production orders, or stock in the plant. Archive or transfer data if needed before locking.
  2. Rename the plant to something like “DO NOT USE – P002” to visually warn users.
  3. Use authorization object M_MSEG_WWA to restrict access to the plant for all users. Coordinate with your security team to remove the plant from user roles.
  4. In Material Master, use the MM/PP Status field in the MARC table to block production and procurement at the plant level. Set X-Plant Material Status to block sales, purchasing, or production globally
  5. In transaction OMWD, deactivate the valuation grouping code for P002. This prevents stock movements and invoice postings
  6. Go to transaction EC02 to remove the plant from organizational assignments (e.g., company code, purchasing org). Also check OX18 to remove plant-to-company code assignment

entry.title: Highlighting a field conditionally
entry.content:
Hi. I am trying to highlight a field DATE_SHIPPED in crystal report based on the status of Load_Status, which never has a null value. My goal is to highlight date_shipped to green if load status is S, and if any other status then highlight red. I have tried different formulas but it is highlighting date_shipped to green only when it has some data. For any other value of load_status (A or P) it is keeping the color default white. I have tried the below,

1. If {Command.load_status} = "S" then crGreen else crRed

2. If {Command.LOAD_STATUS}[1] = 'S' then crGreen else crRed

3. select {Command.LOAD_STATUS}[1]
case 'A':crRed
case 'P':crRed
Default: crGreen

Can someone please help me identifying what mistake I am doing here.

entry.title: Re: Exposing BAPI as OData API using RAP Facade
entry.content:
Hi @dz6 ,

The RAP framework does not allow any statement that would break the logical unit of work (LUW) during a save sequence, including the named statements.
This is not depending on the release but rather one of the following reasons:

  • The BAPI calls a customer BADI, which uses one of the forbidden statements
  • The BAPI calls a nested SAP feature that uses a forbidden statement ( really rare cases in old modules )

Please check the call stack in the short dump to locate the causing statement and from there check the call hierarchy backwards if it  is called by SAP or a customer exit.

If there is no customer code in the stack, please raise a support ticket, else contact the owner of the custom code / BADI implementation.

BR,
